Welcome to GWDZ

Hello there!

I am a philosophy student. This site is my philosophy journal, as much a consequence of my time spent studying philosophy as a cause of it. Here I post topical explainers, argumentative articles, and shower thoughts on interesting questions.

My main interests are in social epistemology. I want to answer one big question: "how should groups of people form their beliefs?". This question is important because societies aren't very good at forming beliefs.

Outside of philosophy, I like cats and fencing (but not fencing cats).

Have fun exploring!

Posts

An Implication of the Preface Paradox

Preface Paradox: Suppose an author has written a book. As she has done due dilligence in checking her sources while writing, for each proposition $p$ in the book, she believes $p$ is true. Nontheless, since the book was long, and knowing that she is fallible, she writes in the preface that there must be at least one mistake in the book. Though... Read more 18 Aug 2022 - 1 minute read
